headline: Shrimp Spring Rolls with Peanut Sauce
description: Spring rolls with shrimp and vegetables are fresh and easy. Make for a snack, appetizer, or light meal. Serve with peanut sauce for dipping!

video.description: Spring rolls with shrimp and vegetables! So fresh and easy. Make for a snack, appetizer, or light meal. Serve with peanut sauce for dipping!
video.name: How to Make Shrimp Spring Rolls

name: Shrimp Spring Rolls with Peanut Sauce
keywords: Restaurant Favorite, Vietnamese, Gluten-Free, Appetizer, Side Dish, Snack, Favorite Spring
recipeIngredient: 2 large carrots, peeled and sliced into matchsticks
2 medium red bell peppers, seeded and sliced into ¼-inch strips
2 Persian cucumbers, sliced into matchsticks (or use half of an English cucumber)
Sweet chili sauce , optional for extra flavor
2 tablespoons low-sodium tamari or soy sauce
2 tablespoons honey (sugar or maple syrup works too)
Juice from 1/2 lime (about 1 to 1 ½ tablespoons)

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your workspace: Fill a wide, shallow bowl, like a pasta bowl, with lukewarm water. Lightly wet the surface of a cutting board. This helps prevent the rice paper from sticking onto the board. Have all your ingredients prepped and arranged in bowls near your workspace. Brush a serving platter with a very light coating of sesame oil or neutral-flavored oil and place it near your work surface; the oil will help prevent the finished rolls from sticking to the platter.

Soften the rice paper wrapper: Dip one of the rice paper wrappers into the water and swirl it around until the entire surface is evenly moistened (20 to 40 seconds or so). It should start to feel softened and malleable. If the rice paper rips or tears, you softened it for too long; discard and start again with a fresh wrapper.

Arrange the vegetables and shrimp on the wrapper: Place the softened rice paper onto the wet board. Arrange some carrots, cucumbers, peppers and a few basil and mint leaves in a line about 1 inch away from the bottom edge of the wrapper. Line 3 pieces of shrimp about 1 1/2 inches above the vegetables. If you like, drizzle a little peanut sauce or sweet chili sauce over the ingredients at this point for some extra flavor.

Wrap the spring rolls: Fold the bottom part of the rice paper wrapper over the vegetables. Continue rolling the everything toward the shrimp. Once you reach the shrimp, stop and fold the left and right sides of the wrapper toward the center. Continue rolling until you reach the top and form a roll. Place the finished spring roll on the platter. Repeat for the remaining spring rolls.

Make the peanut dipping sauce: Mix together the peanut butter, tamari, rice vinegar, honey, lime juice, water, and salt. Taste, and adjust the seasonings to your taste. Transfer to a small bowl and place on the platter with the spring rolls.
Serve the spring rolls: These rolls are best if served the day they are made. If not serving immediately, cover the platter with a slightly damp cloth and refrigerate until ready to serve.

review.reviewBody:
Great recipe. Easy to make. Peanut sauce completions the rolls.Thanks for posting the video on how to assemble the rolls. 
I will make again.
Super fresh, light and delish!!! Love the peanut sauce recipe! I have tried several others and this is a great one!
So fresh and delicious! Great recipe! The Peanut Sauce was delicious, too.
Love these, and the peanut sauce is fabulous! Had to stop myself from eating half of it! Thank you!
I love these - and they look delicious ! I always seem to have the issue of the rice paper wrappers tearing. But, now I know why it happens - thanks for the tip!

item.name: Shrimp Spring Rolls with Peanut Sauce
